```{r load-and-preprocess}
# Load the shootings data from a GeoJSON source
shootings <- st_read("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kyleknox3/STA553/main/week9/shootings.geojson", quiet = TRUE) %>%
  # Filter out rows with NA or infinite values in coordinate columns
  filter(!is.na(point_x) & !is.infinite(point_x) &
         !is.na(point_y) & !is.infinite(point_y))

# Convert 'year' to integer
shootings$YEAR <- as.integer(shootings$year)
```

```{r create-base-map}
# Prepare the base map of Philadelphia
which_state <- "pennsylvania"
philly_info <- map_data("county", region = which_state) %>%
  filter(subregion == "philadelphia")

base_map <- ggplot() +
  geom_polygon(data = philly_info, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group), color = "black", fill = "white") +
  theme_void()
```

```{r create-animation, fig.width=10, fig.height=6.8}
# Define colors for the 'fatal' categories
colors <- c("1" = "red", "0" = "blue") # Ensure these match your data's 'fatal' encoding

# Create the animation
animation <- base_map +
  geom_sf(data = shootings, aes(color = as.factor(fatal)), alpha = 0.5) +
  scale_color_manual(values = colors) +
  transition_time(YEAR) +
  labs(title = 'Year: {frame_time}') +
  shadow_mark()

# Render and save the animation
anim_save("PhillyCrimeByYear.gif", animation)
```
